Provide the final version of the simplified passage

This paper presents a wireless system for monitoring patients' electrical activity of the heart (electrophysiological monitoring). The system includes a device that transmits heart signals (Wireless ECG signal transmitter), a Global Positioning System (GPS) device to track location, and a mobile phone to collect health signals. These signals are sent to a local server using Bluetooth, a wireless technology that allows devices to communicate over short distances. 

Four types of monitoring units have been specifically designed for this wireless communication system: a control center that manages information, a local monitor unit for real-time data, mobile devices such as personal digital assistants (PDA) for on-the-go access, and a web page for both patients and doctors to view information. These various monitoring units are created to meet the different needs of medical staff and patients. 

The aim of this application is to enhance the movement and flexibility of both patients and medical personnel, ultimately improving the quality of healthcare and the patient's lifestyle.
